citation.article-title: Tepidamorphusgemmatus gen. nov.,sp.nov.,a slightly thermophilic member of the Alphaproteobacteria

p.s: Tepidamorphus (L. masc. adj. tepidus, moderately warm, lukewarm, tepid; Gr. masc. adj. amorphos, without form, shapeless; N.L. masc. n. Tepidamorphus, an organism without a distinctive morphology that grows at warm temperatures).
Tepidamorphus forms motile irregular rod-shaped cells with short hyphal-like structures; multiplies by budding.
Chemoorganotrophic, strictly aerobic, oxidase and catalase positive.

Major fatty acids are 19:0cyclo ω8c and 18:0; major phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylcholine; ubiquinone 10 is the major respiratory quinone.
The genus Tepidamorphus belongs to the Alphaproteobacteria.
The type species is Tepidamorphus gemmatus.
